Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: narrow reserved band at top of rim, glazed black below; on wall, reserved band at top with two black lines, glazed below; exterior: black band at top of lip; lip and handle zone reserved with band between; glazed below with reserved line near the foot; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer Identifies the sherd as belonging to a Type 9B South Ionian cup with everted rim. Type 9B cups closely follow the shape and decoration of the Attic Plain Komast cups. These cups coincide with Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Villard’s Ionian Cup Type B2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra, and at the site of Megara Hyblaea on Sicily. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. The number in Petrie's catalogue, 212, is written in ink on the exterior surface.
The cup is of the same type as another dedicated by Ardys, 1886,0401.273.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 212)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 660, no. 173)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 51, no. 231)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.637) (Phase 3)
